channel.title: Tour – Roo's Georgia Tour & Travel Adventures

item.title: Travel above clouds
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The tour offers best option for visitors to find very best side of Georgian culture and nature. Starting to Tbilisi, guests are in the footsteps of Georgian history, hospitality, traditions and green, fresh, breathtakingly beautiful views of Svaneti and Imereti, the places where something great exists, something that just cannot be seen, only felt!

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport, Transfer to a hotel.

2 Martvili canyon

Transfer to Martvili. Martvili Canyons - you visit and enjoy its scenery, waterfalls and take a boat trip in the river with deep green color. Kinchkha Waterfall & Okatse Canyon - Okatse Canyon natural monument with high-quality infrastructure – stairs and footpaths offer magnificent views of the canyon and its surroundings. Overnight in Kutaisi.

3 Mestia

Enguri Dam - the world's second highest concrete arch dam with a height of 271.5 meters, that represents one of the most beautiful and breathtaking sights of Georgia, located on the main road of the World Cultural Heritage Monument Zemo Svaneti (Upper Svaneti). Mestia – Caucasus Spirit, mighty peaks, flower meadows and fantastic hiking areas: Hatsvali Ski Resort, Ski Resort Tetnuldi, the paradise for trekking, hiking, culture-heritage tourism, travel-photography, and skiing. There will be some free time for you get lunch in Georgian local restaurant and get acquainted with Georgian Mountainous traditions.

4 Ushguli

Duration 6 hours, Transfer to Ushguli 1,5 hour drive. You visit Ushguli - Europe‘s Highest Inhabited Village in Upper Svaneti Mountains, located 2,200 m above sea level at the base of the highest peak of the Svanetian mountain range called Shkhara. Ushguli is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The village is most famous for its abundance of watchtowers. Overnight in Mestia

5 Free day in Tbilisi

Transfer to Tbilisi, Shopping and relaxation time

6 Departure

Checking out and departure, Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport.

What's included

  • 6 Days Private Tour

  • English/Arabic/Korean/Russian/Chinese speaking Guide

  • Comfortable air-conditioned car

  • Transfer from the airport to the hotel

  • Transfer from the hotel to the airport

  • 1 Dinner at the Restaurant in Tbilisi

  • 1 Dinner at the Restaurant in Kutaisi

  • Snacks

  • Bottle water for every person per day

  • Snacks

  • Boating at Martvili Canyon

  • All charges & Surcharges

Useful/Additional Information

  • All prices are in USD

  • Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking

  • Children must be accompanied by an adult

  • Not wheelchair accessible

  • A minimum of one person per booking is required

  • A small amount of walking is involved

  • You MUST confirm and obtain any visa requirements prior to border crossing. All visa requirements are the sole responsibility of the traveler

  • Operates in all weather conditions

item.title: 8 day trip in Georgia
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Sometimes an option matters, Sometimes we just know what we want.

How is the best option for 7 days holiday tour alike? Now everyone can find inimitable Georgia in 8 days. From Tbilisi where modern lifestyle is mixed into ancient history to the wild mountains of Kazbegi anyone can be satisfied with the dizzy green atmosphere of the Martvili and Okatse Canyons and Kinchkha waterfall, as well as luxurious resorts of Lopota to rest.

Feel free to contact!

Itinerary

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport. Transfer to a hotel.

2 Tbilisi

Old Tbilisi: Bridge of Peace – a bow-shaped illuminated pedestrian glass bridge - examples of contemporary Tbilisi architecture with breathtaking views of the Old Town; Rike Park – a public recreation area from where the cable car crosses the river Mtkvari to the 4th-century fortress of Narikala, overlooking the historical center of the city; “Kartlis Deda”- Mother of Georgia - one of the most recognized symbols of the country; A Brick Mosque with eight angled Minaret from where the Waterfall of Legvtakhevi and The Bridge of Love lay in a few feet; Sulfur Bathrooms in Abanotubani - famed as a source of the city’s existence. Its water full of natural therapeutic minerals springs from the ground at about 40o C. Restaurant - Free time to get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant. Mtatsminda - Taking the funicular up to the Mtatsminda Park where plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant are available, with great views on Tbilisi. Overnight in Tbilisi.

3 Kazbegi - Dizzying Caucasus Ranges

Transfer from Tbilisi to Kazbegi. Driving up the Georgian Military Highway, visiting Jinvali water reservoir to take amazing photos and if the water is low enough, see the remains of an old village under the water. The Ananuri 16th century Complex - on the Aragvi River with stone walls three churches, reservoir, towers and old prison. Next to The area boating and paddling is available. Gudauri ski resort (2200m) and Gudauri Panorama - paragliding is available in summer as well as riding Motorbikes and horses. Free time to get lunch - sheep shish-kebab in the local restaurant. Gudauri Mineral Waters - colored rock geologic formation made due to few mineral springs there, just by the road. Stepantsminda - a valley town with Holy Trinity Church on the hilltop as well as Gveleti waterfall in the Dariali Gorge. Overnight in Tbilisi.

4 Lopota

Transfer to Lopota. Visit the relaxing and luxurious Lopota lake resort and spa - A small paradise situated in the Lopota Valley, surrounded by green mountains of Caucasus. An ideal peaceful place to rest and discover a variety of fishes, enjoy ride high-breed horses, first class accommodation, wonderful views of the lake and wonderful nature there. Overnight in Lopota

5 Turtle Lake

Transfer to Tbilisi; Gardenia – A brand new gardening, a unique collection of gardening and landscaping ideas, experiences, and products; Turtle Lake – a little corner of wild nature in Tbilisi, full of cafes, relaxation and sports centers. You can ride on the catamaran, cable car, swim and sunbathe there; Tbilisi Gallery Mall

6 Okatse canyon & Kinchkha Waterfall

Transfer to Kutaisi; Kinchkha Waterfall & Okatse Canyon - Okatse Canyon natural monument with high-quality infrastructure – stairs and footpaths offer magnificent views of the canyon and its surroundings. There will be some free time for you get lunch in Georgian local restaurant. Overnight in Kutaisi

7 Martvili Canyon and Transfer to Tbilisi

Transfer to Martvili; Martvili Canyons - you visit and enjoy its scenery, waterfalls and take a boat trip in the river with deep green color; Prometheus Cave - one of Georgia’s natural wonders providing visitors with breathtaking examples of stalactites, stalagmites, petrified waterfalls, cave pearls, underground rivers, and lakes. Overnight in Tbilisi

8 Departure

Checking out and departure; Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport.

What's included

  • Private Tour

  • English/Arabic/Korean/Russian/Chinese speaking Guide

  • Picking up and dropping off

  • Comfortable car

  • Snacks

  • Bottle water for every person per day

  • 4&4 car for getting up to the Gergeti Trinity Church

  • Horse-riding (if available) in Gudauri or Kazbegi

  • 1 Dinner at the Restaurant in Kutaisi

  • All charges & Surcharges

Useful/Additional Information

  • All prices are in USD

  • Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking

  • Children must be accompanied by an adult

  • Not wheelchair accessible

  • A minimum of one person per booking is required

  • A small amount of walking is involved

  • You MUST confirm and obtain any visa requirements prior to border crossing. All visa requirements are the sole responsibility of the traveler

  • Operates in all weather conditions

Terms and Conditions

  • In case of cancellation call us +955 555 30 1143

  • Cancellations are accepted up to 10 days prior to service subject with no cancellation fee

  • Cancellations accepted from 5 to 10 days are subject to the 50% cancellation fee

item.title: Chill and restart in Georgia
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Three best places to Georgia to feel the freshness of Caucasian nature and character. Green hilltops, waterfalls and modern lifestyle are mixed together.

Itinerary

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport; Transfer to a hotel

2 Tbilisi

Old Tbilisi: Bridge of Peace – a bow-shaped illuminated pedestrian glass bridge - examples of contemporary Tbilisi architecture with breathtaking views of the Old Town; Rike Park – a public recreation area from where the cable car crosses the river Mtkvari to the 4th-century fortress of Narikala, overlooking the historical center of the city; “Kartlis Deda”- Mother of Georgia - one of the most recognized symbols of the country; A Brick Mosque with eight angled Minaret from where the Waterfall of Legvtakhevi and The Bridge of Love lay in a few feet; Sulfur Bathrooms in Abanotubani - famed as a source of the city’s existence. Its water full of natural therapeutic minerals springs from the ground at about 40o C. Restaurant - Free time to get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant. Mtatsminda - Taking the funicular up to the Mtatsminda Park where plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant are available, with great views on Tbilisi; Overnight in Tbilisi.

3 Martvili

Transfer to Martvili; Martvili Canyons - you visit and enjoy its scenery, waterfalls and take a boat trip in the river with deep green color; Prometheus Cave - one of Georgia’s natural wonders providing visitors with breathtaking examples of stalactites, stalagmites, petrified waterfalls, cave pearls, underground rivers, and lakes; Overnight in Tbilisi.

4 Kazbegi

Transfer from Tbilisi to Kazbegi; Driving up the Georgian Military Highway, visiting Jinvali water reservoir to take amazing photos and if the water is low enough, see the remains of an old village under the water; The Ananuri 16th century Complex - on the Aragvi River with stone walls three churches, reservoir, towers and old prison. Next to The area boating and paddling is available; Gudauri ski resort (2200m) and Gudauri Panorama - paragliding is available in summer as well as riding Motorbikes and horses; Free time to get lunch - sheep shish-kebab in the local restaurant; Gudauri Mineral Waters - colored rock geologic formation made due to few mineral springs there, just by the road; Stepantsminda - a valley town with Holy Trinity Church on the hilltop as well as Gveleti waterfall in the Dariali Gorge; Overnight in Tbilisi.

5 Departure

Checking out and departure; Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport

item.title: Green days in Georgia
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Three unforgettable days in Tbilisi and mountainous parts of Georgia where anyone can find their own way to take a rest.

Itinerary

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport. Transfer to a hotel.

2 Tbilisi

Old Tbilisi: Bridge of Peace – a bow-shaped illuminated pedestrian glass bridge - examples of contemporary Tbilisi architecture with breathtaking views of the Old Town; Rike Park – a public recreation area from where the cable car crosses the river Mtkvari to the 4th-century fortress of Narikala, overlooking the historical center of the city; “Kartlis Deda”- Mother of Georgia - one of the most recognized symbols of the country; A Brick Mosque with eight angled Minaret from where the Waterfall of Legvtakhevi and The Bridge of Love lay in a few feet; Sulfur Bathrooms in Abanotubani - famed as a source of the city’s existence. Its water full of natural therapeutic minerals springs from the ground at about 40o C. Restaurant - Free time to get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant. Mtatsminda - Taking the funicular up to the Mtatsminda Park where plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant are available, with great views on Tbilisi. Overnight in Tbilisi.

3 Borjomi

Transfer from Tbilisi to Borjomi; On the road enjoy views of peaceful forests, wild rivers, peaks, and valleys, ancient temples; The Mineral Water Park - dating back to 1850 and see the source of Borjomi’s uncial Warm Mineral Spring Water; You can try unique Pine-tree chewing gums as well as Honey degustation; find plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant, outdoor stands selling local honey, jams, and earthenware; Borjomi Cable Car - reach the peak of the Water Park Mountain and take a tour in the forests of the mountain with golf cars to see Borjomi Waterfall; There will be some free time for you get lunch in the Georgian or Asian restaurant; Overnight in Tbilisi

4 Kazbegi

Transfer from Tbilisi to Kazbegi. Driving up the Georgian Military Highway, visiting Jinvali water reservoir to take amazing photos and if the water is low enough, see the remains of an old village under the water. The Ananuri 16th century Complex - on the Aragvi River with stone walls three churches, reservoir, towers and old prison. Next to The area boating and paddling is available. Gudauri ski resort (2200m) and Gudauri Panorama - paragliding is available in summer as well as riding Motorbikes and horses. Free time to get lunch - sheep shish-kebab in the local restaurant. Gudauri Mineral Waters - colored rock geologic formation made due to few mineral springs there, just by the road. Stepantsminda - a valley town with Holy Trinity Church on the hilltop as well as Gveleti waterfall in the Dariali Gorge. Overnight in Tbilisi.

5 Departure

Checking out and transfer to the Tbilisi International Airport

  • English/Arabic/Korean/Russian/Chinese speaking Guide

  • Picking up and dropping off

item.title: Comfort and Adventure
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Best 7-day holiday option for people who wants to take a rest with their loved ones. This tours gives a chance to everyone to feel the freshness of Caucasian mountains as well as the modern lifestyle in Tbilisi, capital of Georgia, where a lot of attractions can be found.

Itinerary

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport; Transfer to a hotel

2 Tbilisi

Old Tbilisi: Bridge of Peace – a bow-shaped illuminated pedestrian glass bridge - examples of contemporary Tbilisi architecture with breathtaking views of the Old Town; Rike Park – a public recreation area from where the cable car crosses the river Mtkvari to the 4th-century fortress of Narikala, overlooking the historical center of the city; “Kartlis Deda”- Mother of Georgia - one of the most recognized symbols of the country; A Brick Mosque with eight angled Minaret from where the Waterfall of Legvtakhevi and The Bridge of Love lay in a few feet; Sulfur Bathrooms in Abanotubani - famed as a source of the city’s existence. Its water full of natural therapeutic minerals springs from the ground at about 40o C. Restaurant - Free time to get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant. Mtatsminda - Taking the funicular up to the Mtatsminda Park where plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant are available, with great views on Tbilisi; Overnight in Tbilisi.

3 Borjomi

Transfer from Tbilisi to Borjomi; On the road enjoy views of peaceful forests, wild rivers, peaks, and valleys, ancient temple;<br /> The Mineral Water Park - dating back to 1850 and see the source of Borjomi’s uncial Warm Mineral Spring Water.</p> <p>You can try unique Pine-tree chewing gums as well as Honey degustation; find plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant, outdoor stands selling local honey, jams, and earthenware;<br /> Borjomi Cable Car - reach the peak of the Water Park Mountain and take a tour in the forests of the mountain with golf cars to see Borjomi Waterfall.</p> <p>There will be some free time for you get lunch in the Georgian or Asian restaurant; Overnight in Tbilisi

4 Turtle Lake

Transfer to Tbilisi; Gardenia – A brand new gardening, a unique collection of gardening and landscaping ideas, experiences, and products; Turtle Lake – a little corner of wild nature in Tbilisi, full of cafes, relaxation and sports centers. You can ride on the catamaran, cable car, swim and sunbathe there; Tbilisi Gallery Mall; Overnight in Tbilisi.

5 Martvili & Imereti

Transfer to Martvili; Martvili Canyons - you visit and enjoy its scenery, waterfalls and take a boat trip in the river with deep green color; Prometheus Cave - one of Georgia’s natural wonders providing visitors with breathtaking examples of stalactites, stalagmites, petrified waterfalls, cave pearls, underground rivers, and lakes; Overnight in Tbilisi.

6 Kazbegi

Transfer from Tbilisi to Kazbegi; Driving up the Georgian Military Highway, visiting Jinvali water reservoir to take amazing photos and if the water is low enough, see the remains of an old village under the water; The Ananuri 16th century Complex - on the Aragvi River with stone walls three churches, reservoir, towers and old prison. Next to The area boating and paddling is available; Gudauri ski resort (2200m) and Gudauri Panorama - paragliding is available in summer as well as riding Motorbikes and horses; Free time to get lunch - sheep shish-kebab in the local restaurant; Gudauri Mineral Waters - colored rock geologic formation made due to few mineral springs there, just by the road; Stepantsminda - a valley town with Holy Trinity Church on the hilltop as well as Gveleti waterfall in the Dariali Gorge; Overnight in Tbilisi.

7 Departure

Checking out and departure; Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport

item.title: Wonderland
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

How is the best option for 6 days holiday tour alike? Now everyone can enjoy precious Georgia in 6 days. From Tbilisi where modern lifestyle is mixed into ancient history to the wild mountains of Kazbegi and shining shore of Black Sea in Batumi, anyone can be satisfied with the dizzy green atmosphere of the Martvili Canyon.

Itinerary

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport. Transfer to a hotel.

2 Tbilisi

Old Tbilisi: Bridge of Peace – a bow-shaped illuminated pedestrian glass bridge - examples of contemporary Tbilisi architecture with breathtaking views of the Old Town; Rike Park – a public recreation area from where the cable car crosses the river Mtkvari to the 4th-century fortress of Narikala, overlooking the historical center of the city; “Kartlis Deda”- Mother of Georgia - one of the most recognized symbols of the country; A Brick Mosque with eight angled Minaret from where the Waterfall of Legvtakhevi and The Bridge of Love lay in a few feet; Sulfur Bathrooms in Abanotubani - famed as a source of the city’s existence. Its water full of natural therapeutic minerals springs from the ground at about 40o C. Restaurant - Free time to get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant. Mtatsminda - Taking the funicular up to the Mtatsminda Park where plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant are available, with great views on Tbilisi. Overnight in Tbilisi.

3 Imereti & Batumi

Transfer to Imereti; Prometheus Cave - One of Georgia’s natural wonders providing visitors with breathtaking examples of stalactites, stalagmites, petrified waterfalls, cave pearls underground rivers, and lakes. Transfer to Batumi; On the cost of the black sea, one of the most popular tourist destination. Overview Batumi and a gorgeous coastline from Argo cable car; Ali&Nino monument – 8meter tall moving steel sculpture – from Kurban Said’s novel to immortalize the love story between a Muslim boy, Ali, and a Christian Georgian princess, Nino; Alphabet tower - a 130-meter-high structure with the Georgian letters built to symbolize the uniqueness of the Georgian alphabet with the restaurant inside; In summer paragliding is available on Black sea as well as you can ride Motorbikes, bikes, Bouts; At night you watch Batumi Dolphin Show; There will be some free time for you get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant; Overnight in Batumi.

4 Makhuntseti Waterfall and Batumi botanical Garden

Transfer to Makhuntseti; Makhuntseti Waterfall - a super representation of the unique landscape of Achara with exotic flora and fauna 335 meters above sea level; Tamari bridge - ancient arched stone Makhuntseti Bridge, where you can find the area for rafting activity; There will be some free time for you get lunch in the Georgian, European or Asian restaurant and to taste regions most famous dish, Acharuli Khachapuri, a bread bowl shaped like a boat with butter, cheese, and an egg. Transfer to Batumi Botanical Garden; The next destination - Batumi botanical Garden with 9 distinct sectors featuring different examples of the plant from the Caucasian subtropics, New Zealand, Australia, South America, the Mediterranean, East Asia, The Himalayas, Mexico. At night you watch Batumi Dolphin Show. Overnight in Batumi.

5 Martvili Canyon and transfer to Tbilisi

Transfer to Martvili; Martvili Canyons - you visit and enjoy its scenery, waterfalls and take a boat trip in the river with deep green color. Prometheus Cave - one of Georgia’s natural wonders providing visitors with breathtaking examples of stalactites, stalagmites, petrified waterfalls, cave pearls, underground rivers, and lakes; Overnight in Tbilisi

6 Departure

Checking out and departure; Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport.

What's included

  • Private Tour

  • English/Arabic/Korean/Russian/Chinese speaking Guide

  • Picking up and dropping off

  • Comfortable car

  • Snacks

  • Bottle water for every person per day

  • Boating at Martvili Canyon

  • 1 Dinner at the Restaurant in Tbilisi

  • Batumi Dolphin Show charges

  • 1 Dinner at the Restaurant in Batumi

  • All charges & Surcharges

Useful/Additional Information

  • All prices are in USD

  • Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking

  • Children must be accompanied by an adult

  • Not wheelchair accessible

  • A minimum of one person per booking is required

item.title: Georgia on your mind
item.dc:creator: georgiatour
item.content:encoded:
Overview

The tour gives all visitors a chance to follow footsteps of Georgian history, culture, hospitality and inimitable nature. Destinations cover all key places, of which the whole country is proud of. The best sightsees are on the way and adventure full of sparkling memories as ahead.

Itinerary

1 Arrival Day

Arrival at Tbilisi International Airport; Transfer to a hotel

2 Tbilisi

Visiting the Old Town; The place offers an unforgettable panoramic view of the Old city, great variety of sights. Here you find different religious buildings – churches, synagogues, mosque. Famous houses with wooden multi-colored balconies as well; Bridge of Peace – a bow-shaped illuminated pedestrian bridge of glass; Rike park – a Beautiful public recreation area. Cable Car at Rike Park - heading to the 4th-century fortress of Narikala overlooking the historical center of the city. “Kartlis Deda” Georgian Mother - One of the most recognized symbols of Georgian character and Metekhi Church (13th century); Waterfall Legvtakhevi and the Bridge of Love; Sulfur Bathrooms in Abanotubani - famed as a source of the city’s existence. Helpful for the respiratory and cardiovascular systems; Tbilisi Synagogue, Sioni Cathedral (6th-7th centuries) and Anchiskhati Church (6th century); Dinner at Restaurant; Mtatsminda Park - taking the funicular up the side of the mountain and in the afternoon we visit Winery and Georgian Tea Museum; Overnight in Tbilisi

3 Borjomi

Transfer from Tbilisi to Borjomi; On the road enjoy views of peaceful forests, wild rivers, peaks, and valleys, ancient temple; The Mineral Water Park - dating back to 1850 and see the source of Borjomi’s uncial Warm Mineral Spring Water. You can try unique Pine-tree chewing gums as well as Honey degustation; find plenty of attractions, cafes, and restaurant, outdoor stands selling local honey, jams, and earthenware; Borjomi Cable Car - reach the peak of the Water Park Mountain and take a tour in the forests of the mountain with golf cars to see Borjomi Waterfall. There will be some free time for you get lunch in the Georgian or Asian restaurant; Overnight in Tbilisi

4 Sataflia Protected Area and Okatse Canyon

Transfer to Kutaisi; Sataflia Protected Area - famous for its rarest caves, geologic and paleontological speleological and botanical monuments, dinosaur footprint from 65 million years ago and glass Bridge over the mountain; Kinchkha Waterfall & Okatse Canyon

5 Martvili Canyon

Transfer to Martvili; Martvili Canyons - you visit and enjoy its scenery, waterfalls and take a boat trip in the river with deep green color; Prometheus Cave - one of Georgia’s natural wonders providing visitors with breathtaking examples of stalactites, stalagmites, petrified waterfalls, cave pearls, underground rivers, and lakes; Overnight in Tbilisi.

6 Free day in Tbilisi

Shopping and relaxation time

7 Kazbegi - Dizzying Caucasus Ranges

Transfer from Tbilisi to Kazbegi; Drive up the Georgian Military Highway,Zhinvali water reservoir to take amazing photos and if the water is low enough,see the remains of an old village through the water. The Ananuri Complex(16th century) on the Aragvi River – Complex turreted stone walls protect three churches one with Celtic style patterns;reservoir,towers and old prison. An amazing area in Zhinvali for boating and paddling in the reservoir. Gudauri ski resort(2200m) The drive heads up into The Great Caucasus Mountains. There will be some free time for you get lunch sheep shish-kebab in the local restaurant Gudauri Panorama. In summer paragliding is available from the hilltop as well as you can ride Motorbikes,horses there in the ranges of Caucasus. Gudauri Mineral Waters - colored rock geologic formation made due to few mineral springs there,just by the road. Stepantsminda - a valley town with the hilltop silhouette of Holy Trinity Church. Gveleti waterfall in the Dariali Gorge – due to one of the opinion there is predicted the beginning of apocalypse millennium and the opening of the huge door with many locks of “Yajuj and Majuj” Overnight in Tbilisi.

8 Departure

Checking out and departure; Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport.
